page.title: 05Hesley Hall-a Rathmell farm
page.content: {Hesley Hall}is a compact farm dating from 1696 with some more recent alterations. The buildings are all made of{stone}and include a small dairy, barns and other out buildings. To the north of the farm there are some ruins. The farm is a{tenant farm} and has been in the same family for over 30 years. There are 6 people living there at the present time. The farm has 110 acres of mainly pasture land for{grazing.}There are several different types of animal including milk cows (Friesian), beef cattle, sheep, horses, chickens and geese. There are 3 tractors on the farm, 2 mechanical diggers (one is a tracked vehicle), 3 muckspreaders and 1 Range Rover.
